basics.name: Angela Morlan
basics.label: Graphic Designer
basics.summary: Professional, team oriented, communicative, organized, aspiring graphic designer with excellent attention to detail, perfected during service as an aviation resource manager in the United States Air Force, strives to produce creative, high quality, and innovative designs with print, web, and video and design software.

work.summary: •	Inspected and evaluated production and maintenance of flight and parachutist records, files and reports for accuracy. Initiated actions to support flight management policies and procedures, and conducted aircrew interviews . •	Ensured accuracy of flight physicals and physiological training qualifications, and also ground and flight training events. Prepared daily flight authorizations, monitored individual flight requirements and reviewed flying hours. •	Maintained control and accountability of the Aviation Resource Management System (ARMS) by providing accurate and timely updates of flight hours and training accomplishments.
highlights: Promotion to Senior Airman, Fairchild Air Force Base, WA September 2012
Excellence for guidance given to military spouses, base chapel study, Fairchild Air Force Base, WA April 2012
Excellent duty performance, 22 Expeditionary Air Refueling Squadron, Transit Center at Manas, Kyrgyzstan,  Operation Enduring Freedom December 2011, January 2013
Academic Achievement, Aviation Resource Management Apprentice Course, Keesler Air Force Base, MS November 2010
Basic Military Training Honor Flight Graduate, 331 Training Squadron, Lackland Air Force Base, TX August 2010

work.summary: •	Printed direct mail on Nipson 7000 Laser Web Printer and provided quality control and accurate records of product quantity. •	Performed insert machine operation, quality control and hand sorting operation.

•	Prepared bank marketing portfolios and displays utilizing Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop. •	Typed invoices and e-mails, operated fax machine, proofread and organized files. •	Provided creative feedback for format of displays.

work.company: Salem High Vocational Center, Salem, NH
work.summary: •	Performed printing operations of forms, booklets, and calendars for Salem School District. •	Designed school forms with Adobe PageMaker. •	Produced lithographic plates for printing on the Ryobi sheet fed press. •	Performed various finishing operations utilizing multiple bindery machines.

volunteer.summary: Interpret and present the daily life of Confederate and Federal soldiers, and their families and associates, for the public through living history, reenactments, first person characterizations and education of the Civil War during the period of 1861 to 1865.
highlights: Participated in the 150th Anniversary Battle Gettysburg, PA

volunteer.position: Sorter/Packer for food distribution to people in need

volunteer.summary: Joined efforts with Airman's Ministries Center of Fairchild Air Force Base and volunteers of Habitat for Humanity for house construction projects in Deer Park, WA
Mission Trip, Puerto Cabezas, Nicaragua July 2000, Jul 2001
highlights: •	Taught Bible lessons and made crafts with children at school
•	Ministered  at park through dance, drama, film and testament distribution
•	Ministered at prison through worship and testimonies
•	Constructed foundation of school and roof of church

education.area: Visual Communication Design/ Minor Web Application Development

education.institution: Community College of the Air Force
education.studyType: Earned 48 credit hours towards Associate of Applied Science Degree

education.institution: Lakes Region Community College, Laconia, NH

awards.title: Scholarship Winner
awards.awarder: New England Printing and Publishing Council

awards.title: Inducted into National Vocational-Technical Honor Society
